titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Records of the Chesapeake Bay Commission, 1982-1996
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 41003
titlepage.author: Erin Faison

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records of the Chesapeake Bay Commission, 1982-1996. Accession 41003, State Government Records Collection, The Library of Virginia. Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transfered by Melanie Davenport, agency records officer for the Chesapeake Bay Commission, Richmond, Virginia, 12 January, 2004.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Chesapeake Bay Commission is a tri-state legislative commission created in 1980 (S350, chap. 662, approved Apr. 4, 1980) to advise the general assemblies of Maryland, Virginia and Pennsylvania on matters relating to the Chesapeake Bay. The commission serves as the legislative arm of the multi-jurisdictional Chesapeake Bay Program and acts in an advisory capacity. The commission consists of 21 members: five legislators from each state, cabinet secretary from each state who is responsible for managing natural resources, and three citizen representatives.

The Chesapeake Bay Program was created in 1983 to direct the restoration and protection the Chesapeake Bay, focusing on the Bay's living resources and researching the problems of nutrient over-enrichment, dwindling underwater Bay grasses, and toxic pollution. The program is a unique regional partnership that is led by the Chesapeake Executive Council. The members of the council include the governors of Maryland, Virginia and Pennsylvania; the mayor of the District of Columbia; the administrator of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency; and the chair of the Chesapeake Bay Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, subject files, publications and legislative files collected by the Chesapeake Bay Commission. The material documents the Commission's efforts to save the Chesapeake Bay and replenish marine life. Topics include shellfish, oysters, shad, state an national Bay reform legislation, Commission authored publications, as well as, Bay related research materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series I. Correspondence and Subject Files

scopecontent.p: Series I contains files which document meetings of committees and councils attended by Russell "Russ" W. Baxter, with representatives of the Chesapeake Bay Commission. There are also files pertaining to key areas of interest for the Commission including estuaries, tributaries and shellfish. This series also contains the resolutions, briefs, budgets and newsletters written by the Commission. This series includes correspondence from W. Tayloe Murphy, Jr., Otis L. Brown, Elmo G. Cross and Governor L. Douglas Wilder.

did.unittitle: Chesapeake Bay: A Framework for Action, 1983.
Chesapeake Bay Local Assistance Department (Regulation Review), 1994.
Chesapeake Bay Program Fiscal Year 1995 (Budget Proposal), 1994.
Virginia Delegation to Chesapeake Bay Commission (Briefing Book), 1990.

scopecontent.p: Series II consists of files pertaining to legislation proposed by the Chesapeake Bay Commission at both the state and federal level, as well as research notes and documents relating to the creation of bills and resolutions.

did.unittitle: House Joint Resolution 95 (Public hearings and comments), 1994.
House Joint Resolution 95 (Shellfish Study Committee public hearings), 1994.

scopecontent.p: Series III contains published materials covering the topics of aquaculture, fisheries, molluscks, polution, preservation, oysters, restoration, and sanitation. The majority, but not all, of the publications are specific to the state of Virginia. The series also includes four VHS tapes on shellfish and fishing, as well as tapes on the Chesapeake Bay Symposium.

did.unittitle: Aquatic Resources and Nonpoint Source Pollution, 1995.
Chesapeake Bay Introduction to an Ecosystem, 1995.
Economics of Molluscan Introductions and Transfers, 1992.
Fisheries/Shellfish Research (States other than Virginia), Various.
Protecting Drinking Water Supplied Through Watershed Management, 1982.
Regulatory Permits and Requirements for Commercial Aquaculture in Virginia, 1993.
Rehabilitation of the Troubled Oyster Industry, 1988.
Restoration of the Virginia Oyster Fishery, 1994.
Strategic Planning and Performance Measurement Proposal, 1994.
